arts.ttl: Bukayo Saka, Sterling, White - Latest Arsenal injury news and return dates for Brentford clash - football.london
arts.sum: With all of that being said, football.london has rounded up the latest Arsenal injury news and return dates before the away game against the Bees on New Year's Day. The other two players unavailable due to injury are Ben White and Takehiro Tomiyasu, with it unclear when either defender will return.

arts.ttl: Mikel Arteta's two answers give honest portrayal of where Arsenal stand in title race
arts.sum: Arsenal managed to stay in touch with Premier League leaders Liverpool are seeing off Ipswich but Mikel Arteta admits they need to take strides forward if they want to land the title

arts.ttl: 'Credit to him': Declan Rice says one Arsenal star wasn't fully fit vs Ipswich, but he still played 90 minutes
Arsenal next five Premier League fixtures compared to Liverpool and Chelsea in title race
arts.sum: Arsenal proved they can win Premier League games without Bukayo Saka as Mikel Arteta's side beat Ipswich Town 1-0 at Emirates Stadium. Verdict: Arsenal have a number of difficult Premier League fixtures on the horizon, including three challenging trips on their travels and two games at home against teams they failed to beat last season at Emirates Stadium.

arts.ttl: Raheem Sterling makes Arsenal future decision as Matheus Cunha links intensify
arts.sum: Leandro Trossard and Jorginho are among the names Arsenal have signed mid-way through a campaign in recent years, although it remains to be seen whether the north London club will enter the January market this time around. football.london says: It's no surprise to see some speculation surrounding Sterling's future given his lack of minutes in an Arsenal shirt.

arts.ttl: Arsenal and Mikel Arteta blamed for Bukayo Saka injury
arts.sum: Former Tottenham Hotspur midfielder Jamie O'Hara has blamed Mikel Arteta and Arsenal for Bukayo Saka's injury after claiming the winger was overused prior to the unfortunate event. I know Arsenal are hugely reliant on Bukayo Saka with what he can produce on the pitch, but this was always going to happen.

arts.ttl: 'I was scared': Emmanuel Petit shares what frightened him about Arsenal in win over Ipswich
arts.sum: Arsenal managed to get over the line against Ipswich Town on Friday night as they closed the gap to Premier League leaders Liverpool to six...

arts.ttl: Gabriel Martinelli fails his audition as search begins for Bukayo Saka’s heir | Nick Ames
arts.athr: Nick Ames at the Emirates Stadium
arts.sum: Arsenal do enough to beat Ipswich but are no closer to solving the problem of their star attacker’s injury absence In the north London mist, Arsenal came no closer to stumbling upon a temporary heir to their starboy. This was ultimately an exercise in doing the necessary, making sure realistic hope of a title challenge extended towards the season’s second half and overcoming a well-coached but impotent Ipswich. Yet if the hope had been that it would offer a window into a prolonged run without Bukayo Saka, the wait for answers will now drift into early 2025. The pre-match hype had centred on Gabriel Martinelli, moved across from his usual left-sided perch upon Saka’s injury at Selhurst Park and quickly settling down with a goal in that thrashing. Martinelli is an explosive yet mercurial talent; the darkest fears during his more barren stretches concern whether, at 23, his ceiling may not be far off. But here was a chance to prove he could be the man to deputise over a longer stretch: at least two months, as Mikel Arteta explained afterwards. On the face of things, Ipswich were ideal fodder against whom to state the case. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Arsenal: Mikel Arteta hopeful over Raheem Sterling injury boost amid major Bukayo Saka blow
arts.sum: Chelsea loanee could be back sooner than expected to help cover the loss of injured talisman, who will be sidelined until at least March

arts.ttl: The Verdict: Arsenal edge past Ipswich but Saka loss a 'huge blow'
arts.sum: Sky Sports News' Danyal Khan and Nick Wright look at how Arsenal coped in their first match without star man Bukayo Saka against Ipswich.
